text:
WASHINGTON, D.C.—Still reeling from Trump’s previous Supreme Court nominee, Neil Gorsuch, Democrats plan to scrutinize any new nominee to ensure that he or she isn’t yet another crony of something called “The Constitution,” Senate Democrats announced Friday.

“Time and time again, we find progressive laws getting struck down,” Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer said in a Senate address. “And it’s always — always — the ones the Constitution is against. These right-wing judges don’t think for themselves, they just do whatever the Constitution says. And it’s time for that to end.”

Senate Democrats have vowed to make sure that any new nominee isn’t going to be beholden to outside influences like the Constitution, the founding fathers, or the rule of law. “We need judges to be advocates of progressive laws,” Senator Elizabeth Warren added. “Not people who will bow to the whims of the Constitution, pitting its extremist values of freedom of speech and freedom of religion against our agenda.”

“We’re sick and tired of the Constitution sitting in the National Archives, manipulating everything we do,” stated Senator Cory Booker, trying to emote for the cameras but failing. Booker then called a ten-minute recess for him to refresh his supply of fake tears before he could continue.

Asked about their concerns, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said he “doesn’t care” and plans to “completely ignore” the Democrats in the nomination process since “there’s nothing they can do” and he is “literally unstoppable.”
title: Senate Democrats Demand Supreme Court Nominee Not Be Unduly Influenced By U.S. Constitution

meta_data.generatorComments: ["I thought this was supposed to be satire!","You used to be good, but now you just do lame Christian stuff.","I miss Adam Ford.","I usually like satire, but this time you've gone too far!","This ain't it, chief.","Can we get a fact-check here, Snopes?","Ok, boomer.","How dare you!","Do better.","Wait, is this real?","Conservatives only have two jokes.","This would be funny if it weren't so true!","You used to be good, but now you just do lame political stuff.","You used to be good, but now you\u2019re just a Trump hating rag.","You used to be good, but now you\u2019re just a right-wing hating rag.","You used to be good, but now you\u2019re just lazy.","Too political.","Too soon!","There's no way that this is true!","I don't get it.","Didn't this start out as a satire site?","I'm just here for the comments.","Reported.","At least Hillary's not president.","Racist!","I know this is satire, but it's still dangerous.","But wait, didn't this actually happen?","I don\u2019t think that this is the subject to try to satirize. There\u2019s too much hurt and pain to try to laugh off. This tweet and article should have stayed in the drafts folder.","First!","The Bee hasn't been funny in quite a while. I think they sold the site a while back to some right-wing nut and now all their jokes are about politics.","This is MAGA propaganda.","This is transphobic. Do better.","What on earth is wrong with you??","This article contains a type of humor that has not been appropriate or funny in my lifetime or yours.","Good one, Todd.","I understand that this is satire.","The Bee used to be funny, but now they just traffick in misinformation under the guise of satire.","The comments generated are boring and always the same.","This will be reality before you know it!","This might be funny, but you should have never told that joke about Simone Biles.","Let's go Brandon!","This article is further proof that The Babylon Bee is neither funny nor Christian.","Sincerely go eat a sack of bees","This wouldn't be the first time I got fooled by the Bee!","For the first time in my life, I can look in the mirror and admit that I am in love with Kyle Mann's Twitter persona.","I miss that guy that was obsessed with bears.","What is Christian about this?"]
